oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diversity-oriented approach to biologically relevant molecular frameworks starting with beta-naphthol and using the claisen rearrangement and olefin metathesis as key steps
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
MANDAL, K
TIWARI, A
MOBIN, SM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: claisen rearrangement
diversity-oriented synthesis
metathesis
naphthoxepines
spiro compounds
ring-closing metathesis
allylic acetate isomerization
catalyzed enyne metathesis
amino-acid derivatives
diels-alder reaction
silica-gel support
organic-synthesis
grubbs catalyst
phenylalanine derivatives
pyridinium chlorochromate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A diversity-oriented approach for the synthesis of various structurally different molecular frameworks from readily accessible and common precursors is described. A Claisen rearrangement followed by ring-closing metathesis or ethylene-promoted ring-closing enyne metathesis has been utilized as the key synthetic transformation to generate naphthoxepine derivatives. The ring-closing metathesis approach has also been used to generate spirocyclic compounds and the pleiadene framework.
